faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.partnersTitle: Some of the partners who trust us

0.question: Are you a real estate company?
0.answer: No, we‚Äôre a relocation agency that specializes in helping people find housing in Madrid and Barcelona.We work closely with several real estate agencies to offer our clients a wide selection of verified properties.

1.question: What‚Äôs the difference between a short-term and a long-term apartment?
1.answer: A short-term apartment is rented for a few months (usually between 1 and 11), though it can match the length of your studies. It normally comes fully furnished‚Äîperfect for study or work stays. A long-term apartment, on the other hand, is usually unfurnished and rented with a standard residential contract lasting between 3 and 5 years.

2.question: What do I need to apply for a short-term apartment?
2.answer: To rent a short-term apartment, it‚Äôs very important to prove the length of your stay. Usually, you‚Äôll need to provide an acceptance letter from your university or school showing your study dates, or an employment letter stating how long you‚Äôll be working in Spain.

3.question: What do I need to rent an apartment?
3.answer: For short-term rentals, you‚Äôll typically need: Your passport and your guarantor‚Äôs (if applicable), your student ID or acceptance letter from your school or university, proof of income, such as recent bank statements, a letter of introduction and additional documents may be requested by the real estate agency if necessary.

4.question: What payments are required?
4.answer: You‚Äôll usually need to pay: Two months‚Äô deposit (security deposit), agency fee (equivalent to one month‚Äôs rent + VAT, or 10% of the annual rent + VAT), first month‚Äôs rent and ITP tax and utilities.

5.question: Can the agency fee be avoided?
5.answer: Agency fees are a standard part of the rental process and must be covered by the tenant. Only in rare cases‚Äîwhen there‚Äôs a direct agreement with the property owner‚Äîcan these fees be avoided, although such options are very uncommon.

6.question: Is your service only for students?
6.answer: Our service supports anyone moving to Spain, whether for studies or professional reasons, and we also work directly with companies relocating their employees.

7.question: What does your service include?
7.answer: Our service includes comprehensive support throughout the entire relocation process. We carry out a fully personalized housing search and personally visit each property to ensure it is real, safe, and meets our quality standards. We work exclusively with 100% verified properties. We negotiate directly with real estate agencies, present all required documentation on your behalf, and manage the entire rental process from the first contact to the contract signing. Upon your arrival, we welcome you in the city, accompany you to your new home, and conduct a detailed inventory and condition check to ensure everything is in perfect order, so you can move in with complete peace of mind.
